nodes.text: Friendly reminder that friendship is more important than political views, so stop breaking apart from friends just because they have different political views, I see it all the time and it's pretty sad that someone would leave someone for something as stupid as that
@crossfirebat Nope not gonna deal with right wingers as „friend“. If someone wanna be a bigot he can do this without me
@crossfirebat no no it's fine\n*pets bat* we still frens
@Walroose64 Eee
@Walroose64 But yeah I'll leave you to online school sorry for the distraction

@Walroose64 Exactly the adaptability that's a big issue with a lot of those people, i don't believe it has anything to do with their race or anything (because then the people in other places like US would be the exact same which they aren't) but with the circumstances they've grown up with

@Walroose64 Once again, i just go off of what I experience, and from what I have experienced so far is that a majority of illegal immigrants are a problem here, the legal ones and some illegal ones are actually fine they actually are really determined to find a job and adapt, but it's ↓

@crossfirebat yeah well all politicians are corrupt in some way so you're definitely correct in using quotation marks there\n\nanyways if you're okay with it I would like to discuss some of this in dms sometime later, I don't think you're racist, but I think some of your beliefs are questionable
@Walroose64 Good thing that my region is an autonomy, so "we" (our region president) do get to decide for ourselves for most things
@Walroose64 I don't think it's only in italy germany has it as well and austria, that's why they control trucks and cars quite carefully at borders

@Walroose64 Oh and of course, it's all paid with our money, hence why people are getting mad and why they wanna close the border in the south and really restrict the controls but the south is too currupt to be told to do so, down there it's all ruled by the mafia, it's really sad
@crossfirebat italy you silly goose that isn't how refuge is supposed to work

@crossfirebat ohh yeah I remember that\n\nunder any other circumstances I would say that's an excuse to not show proof, but in this case, I literally know that they hide this stuff; that's one thing about the italian government that I do know

@Walroose64 I did say it before, they get 800€ a month for nothing, refugee in 3-4 star hotels, and free food. And I've seen videos where they complain about the wifi being slow :) not to mention that I see a lot of them with iPhone 11s and smart watches and all that stuff
@Walroose64 That's just how Italy has been and will probably always be

@Walroose64 There's no official statistics behind it that prove either sides wrong or right because the Italian gouvernment tries to hide things like these, for example by mass reporting about corona or something

@crossfirebat yea sorry I'm way too predisposed to American debates, whenever someone talks about illegal immigrants it's usually an unfounded and totally inaccurate opinion of them, but in this case you might be correct, though I'd have to see the statistics behind it

@Walroose64 here. Most people that make it here are people that were doing just fine, but wanted to come here just because it's better in europe, and knowing from people that already came here calling them then, that they get free money, obviously encourages them even more. ↓

@Walroose64 So a lot of people throw away their ID cards and claim they're from those specific assigned war territories and come here and have the excuse that they lost the ID card. Only blood testings then later prove they're not actually from there but you can't do that when there's like↓
@Walroose64 Hundreds of people coming every day/week, it would take a lot of time and money and you can't always control it obviously

@Walroose64 Here they're illegal because we are letting in people that come over here to flee from war territories. But most of the time, those actual poor war fugitives don't even make it here, since they have nothing to pay the illegal shippers, that put them on the ships and send them ↓

@Walroose64 I definitely know enough to see what the problems of my country are. And illegal immigration is definitely a very big one. Apart from mafia in the south, general poverty, having a lot of debts and a lot of unemployment, again mostly in the south, another big problem is covid ofc

@crossfirebat I'm guessing because it takes a lot more money to travel to America, so the immigrants that come here are usually relatively wealthy in comparison to their home countries\n\nAlso most illegal immigrants are only illegal because they overstayed their visas
@Walroose64 No idea who that is and what you're saying, I'm not really aware of all that trans rights stuff and i don't really care and have any interest in it
@crossfirebat well she's a trans woman who hates trans people\n\ntransphobes also hate trans people; but since Blaire White hates trans people too, transphobes consider her "one of the good ones"
@Walroose64 Here it's the other way around
@crossfirebat that's not quite what I mean\n\nit's like how transphobes will validate and respect Blaire White's gender, despite her being trans, simply because she also is transphobic
@crossfirebat that's why I said "at a far lower rate" as in disproportionately less\n\neven considering the difference in population, immigrants still commit a lot fewer crimes (in America at least)
@Walroose64 Yeah i mean that's what you're supposed to do with all your friends, if they're not one of the good ones, they wouldn't be real friends
@crossfirebat I feel like I know far too little about policies where you live to have an educated debate
@Walroose64 Maybe because there's less illegal immigrants than the entire rest of the population, see it doesn't make sense to compare that.
@Walroose64 And then they're also being spoiled by the system and basically encouraged do do so. So that's not helping either which is why a lot of countries are slowly leaving the EU

@crossfirebat statistically, immigrants (even illegal immigrants) commit less crimes\n\nnot sure if it's the same for Europe but in America immigrants commit crimes at a far lower rate than the general population
@crossfirebat because you've classified them as "one of the good ones"

@Walroose64 I don't think its part of what race or whatever they are, but the way theyre being raised and their circumstances and it's passed over generations, and generations doesnt apply to the US because they're born there but the ones here, mostly immigrated here illegally, its different

@crossfirebat I don't doubt that these things are true but the fact you're attributing it to race instead of the individual is what sets off the alarms off in my head\n\nidc how big of a pattern it is, race doesn't matter in that context, and attributing it to race is just race realism

@crossfirebat I get your environment had a big factor in how your beliefs developed, I live in a relatively wealthy suburban area, so I never had these experiences, but again these are just experiences and not statistical fact\n\ninstead of attributing it to race, attribute it to the system
@Walroose64 Well if I was scared of them, why would I be friends with them?
@crossfirebat I don't doubt you have black friends but it means literally nothing

@Walroose64 I have personal experience of multiple african people menacing me for just looking  in their direction and about the people being stabbed in that park is actually true, it's been in the news multiple times. And in newspapers, and literally whitnessed by a friend of mine as well.
@Walroose64 Do I have to link you to their instagram pages or something to make you believe lol?
@crossfirebat oh my god you're even using the black friends argument... i cant

@crossfirebat ok I gotta do schoolwork but it's super obvious to me you've been listening to the wrong people because you are so unaware of how terrible the things you are saying actually are, it's frightening to me that someone can be this unaware\n\nI wanna talk later, I'm actually concerned
@Walroose64 Don't put words in my mouth that i didn't say. I explained precisely why I'm sacred to go into that park, not that I'm scared of black people, i actually have a lot of black friends.
@Walroose64 That's not what I said
@Walroose64 Read what I write, and don't only read what you want it to say, but what i actually said
@crossfirebat "I'm not scared of black people I'm just scared of being stabbed by them" WTF
@crossfirebat dude are you legit trolling right now how can you look at what you're saying and not say that it's disgustingly fucking racist what the hell
@Walroose64 How is it racist, I'm just telling what's happening, literally everyone is scared to go in that place

@Walroose64 1 i didn't say the person is illegal but they are coming here illegally, without permission.\n\n2 I'm not scared of black people, I'm scared to go into the park in the center of my city because literally every week someone gets stabbed there by an african person, ↓

@Walroose64 And i don't only mean that it's between local people but also between themselves. Every week. It's not funny, it's really scary, thinking that it used to be a fun and nice place to hang out and for kids to play in the park.
@crossfirebat 1) no human should be considered illegal\n\n2) so you admit you're scared of black people

@Walroose64 And get pain 800€(from the taxes we pay) a month for doing nothing. I think it's a serious problem and i think it's not because they're so oppressed because they for sure aren't, it's more like they're being spoiled too much by the government

@crossfirebat If you're correct here (which I don't know if you are because I'm not involved in European politics) there are still a hell of a lot of red flags in what you just said but regardless\n\nblm is a primarily American movement

@Walroose64 Of course there's also the good ones that want to cooperate and adapt but the majority of people that come here from Africa are not even here legally and weren't even from a war territory, they literally throw their IDs away so they can't identify where they're from to get here↓

@Walroose64 Since they most definitely are not oppressed here in italy, because they're literally put over the local and legal inhabitants of this country, they get paid with our taxes, that we pay, for what? Doing absolutely nothing but sitting in parks and scaring people and selling drugs

@Walroose64 Oh because selling drugs and sex is legal in europe? It's not and it's heavily enforced, now at least in the most part, in italy it's not as bad. And once again guess who is selling them? Black people and foreigners! You see a pattern? I don't think it's being oppressed ↓
@crossfirebat why do you think they are selling them

@crossfirebat Drugs and sex work are both heavily criminalized in America, and because of that, gangs have propped up to illegally sell drugs and sex on the black market. Europe isn't as strict with their policies, that's why there aren't as many gangs there.

@Walroose64 Also if you read it carefully it says, "so as to distinguish them as superior or inferior to the other" \n\nnot just to distinguish them for their abilities or characteristics. thats not what racism is.
@crossfirebat that would be race realism which is often used to justify actual racism

@Walroose64 I never said they're lazier, just that they tend to not go for what they could do, and i think it's a lot about their mindset that they're put up to because of how much the media supports them.
@crossfirebat This just sounds like a theory
@Walroose64 War of drugs and sex? In what sense?

@crossfirebat Did I say it was okay to do crime because you're poor? I never said that\n\nAnd yes there's a big reason for that; in Europe, they don't have a War on Drugs and a War on Sex like America does, and those are the reason why gangs exist

@Walroose64 Oh so because I'm poor I'm justified to be a criminal? Okay let me just Rob a bank real quick, I'm sure it'll be fine, I'm poor i can do whatever I want :)\n\nYou see there's a lot of much poorer people here as well, but they don't go around and do street crime, and theyre starving

@Walroose64 But what you're saying is I'm racist, because I point out facts about black people. How is it racist? It's just how it is, being racist is publicallly discriminating them or constantly calling them the n word in attempt to offend them.

@crossfirebat It's because of the wealth gap, not because black people are 'lazier'\n\nSlavery, then Jim Crow, then redlining, and now gerrymandering have all been used to keep black people down in the lower class, and poor people are more likely to be involved in street crime

@crossfirebat Remember when I said "people who have a problem with blm almost always have super racist opinions"

Yeah this is that
This take is a massive, massive yikes from me

When you're systemically disadvantaged, sometimes the only reliable way to make money is to get involved in gangs

@Walroose64 I don't believe they are forced to do it, since a lot of black people still do very good. Of course some people get pulled into it, but it's not the highest part, there's white gangs too just that population is mainly white so it kinda evens itself out cuz more work
@Walroose64 Again I don't really know much about it, but just from watching it a few times I can tell that they're mainly leftist
@crossfirebat Trust me, from the perspective of a leftist: no the hell they're not lol
@crossfirebat This is not true at all, if you were to say liberal I'd agree with you, but leftist? Fuck no, all those mfs are capitalists, there's no such thing as a leftist capitalist
@Walroose64 And it's true that most part of the media is leftist you can not ignore that lol. Of course 95% was an exaggeration, but it's a pretty big part of US media that's leftist.

@Walroose64 I mean that's what I've gathered, and found out, and it's true, you see a lot more black people around doing nothing and just walking around in their gangs than white people, it's not due to them being capable to do less but a lot just don't want to or are being forced not to.

@Walroose64 Of course not every black person is like that but a very high percentage is, and even if it's not over 50%, i don't really know those people are still the ones that pull the average wage down by A LOT

@Walroose64 I don't see that, there might be discrimination between people, but I don't see the reporting bias one since 95% of media is leftist, wealth gap is purely down to interest and it just seems like white people on average, put more work in and that's why they make more.
@Walroose64 But what do I know I'm just a dumb european :)
@crossfirebat well in the US black people really get the short end of the stick\n\nRacial profiling, reporting bias, racial wealth gap, you name it, black people are very disadvantaged in America
@Walroose64 Here Black people and Foreign people are definitely on the upper hand and the actual local people are being pressured and "oppressed"

@crossfirebat unfortunately sometimes you gotta get your hands dirty to fight for your rights, and black people are still significantly marginalized. I don't support burning down private businesses and homes, but I couldn't care less about what happens to the local Target

@Walroose64 But yeah coming back to the original topic, in a server, someone literally left and stopped being good friends with someone else just because of something like this and I think it's completely stupid to do so
@crossfirebat yea I'm literally a radical leftist and anarcho-communist and that sounds dumb to me

@crossfirebat obviously the rioters aren't innocent, and there's definitely riots that started violent and were never peaceful, I don't deny that\n\npersonally it feels like whenever someone says "they should just obey the law" that sounds to me like "the slaves should have just followed orders"

@Walroose64 Yes, there's also a lot of evidence proving the exact opposite, for a lot of cases. You see it all depends on what side you're on on how you see it and what you believe. I don't quite believe either side, but if I see someone burning down a house, that's who I believe less.

@Walroose64 Yeah see i don't agree with you there, you can't always blame everything on the other side and your side is holy. There's always idiots in both sides. But now I ask you, since this is a very good example, would you now stop being my friend because I believe that?
@crossfirebat only 6% of protests become violent and it's almost always because of instigation from either the police or from right-wing extremists

@Walroose64 Yes I meant the organization, English is not my first language, but for example, destroying buildings and stuff and I'm not gonna go over all the stuff that people have done in those "pEaCeFuL" protests, I don't agree with

@crossfirebat there's nothing wrong with the movement tho, the organization I can understand, but the movement is literally just "stop systemic racism"\n\nPlus every single time I've engaged with someone like that I have managed to prove they have very racist opinions
@Walroose64 I don't think that many people have a problem with the actual phrase "Black Lives Matter" but more with the movement that's hiding behind it. And what their ideas and methods are

@crossfirebat obviously I'm exaggerating, but there definitely are quite a lot of very racist people, I mean just look at how many people have a problem with the phrase "black lives matter"\n\nI do somewhat agree with you though, human rights shouldn't be considered politics
@Walroose64 Black people should still be slaves is not a political view, that's just being straight up racist and there are very few people left that believe that
@crossfirebat depends on the political views\n\nis it "I favor capitalism over socialism" or is it "black people should still be slaves"
